definitions.text: the syllable naming the first (tonic) note of any major scale in solmization
carry out or perform an action
examples: John did the painting, the weeding, and he cleaned out the gutters
the skater executed a triple pirouette
How is she doing in her new job?
How are you making out in graduate school?

definitions.text: give rise to; cause to happen or occur, not always intentionally
carry out or practice; as of jobs and professions
be sufficient; be adequate, either in quality or quantity
examples: This car suits my purpose well
A 'B' grade doesn't suffice to get me into medical school

definitions.text: create or design, often in a certain way
examples: I did this piece in wood to express my love for the forest

definitions.text: behave in a certain manner; show a certain behavior; conduct or comport oneself
examples: You should act like an adult
What makes her do this way?
The dog acts ferocious, but he is really afraid of people

definitions.text: spend time in prison or in a labor camp
examples: He did six years for embezzlement
We could do with a little more help around here
dress my hair for the wedding
This car does 150 miles per hour
We did 6 miles on our hike every day
